info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 7:40AM CDT until April 30 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Haskell, Jones, Shackelford and Throckmorton.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haskell, Stamford, Anson, Lueders, Weinert, Avoca, Paint Creek, Lake Stamford Marina, Nugent, Irby, Big Country Baptist Assembly, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Farm Road 600, Funston, Tuxedo and Truby. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 212 crossing California Creek, Loop Road crossing Paint Creek, County Road 274 crossing Brushy Creek, crossings along County Road 247, County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek, County Road 245 crossing California Creek, County Road 242 crossing Flag Branch, County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek, County Road 261 crossing Cottonwood Creek and County Road 209 crossing Post Oak Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Haskell, TX; Jones, TX; Shackelford, TX; Throckmorton, TX
